question.title: Configure IntelliJ to generate Java 25+ code using IO rather than System.out/System.in
question.body:
Java 25 gained the convenience class IO for simpler access to the console, with print, println, & readln methods. See JEP 512: Compact Source Files and Instance Main Methods for details.

In my Java 25 projects, IntelliJ IDEA 2025.3 EAP continues suggesting & generating code using System.out/System.in rather than IO.

Is there some way to get IntelliJ to use IO?

I know IntelliJ provides a Live Template iop for println() and ior for readln(), expanding them into the IO methods. See the company blog post. My question refers to code suggested or generated by the IDE.

answers.body:
If you are talking about AI suggested/generated code, I'm afraid it would take some time for it to start suggesting IO.println() due to the large volume of training material using System.out.println().

But I will take your feedback and see whether there is something we can do. (Disclaimer: I work at JetBrains)

In the meantime, we do have an inspection + quick-fix to replace System.out.println() with IO.println().

  • Press Alt+Enter on System.out.println() to find the inspection.
  • To replace all instances of System.out.println() in a file, click the more button (…) and select "Fix all in file".
  • To replace all instances of System.out.println() in your project, use "Run inspection by name" (you can find this option using Shift Shift for Search Everywhere and select "Method from java.lang.IO can be used".

79782349.body: Updating to add that we have created a ticket for your feedback: youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IJPL-211965
@BasilBourque Thanks for your feedback. As mentioned in the answer, I'm taking your feedback to see what we can do. (As mentioned, I work at JetBrains)

Thanks for your response. I understand the pile of “training” material problem. But surely an AI should be smart enough to do a simple search-and-replace! Just swap out System.out.println() for IO.println() in the context of Java 25+.
